channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Evacuations after Leamington Spa fire explosions
item.description: Police at the industrial blaze say one person is unaccounted for as emergency crews work to locate them.

item.title: Afghanistan: Pen Farthing through Kabul airport security with animals
item.description: The Ministry of Defence said Pen Farthing and his animals are awaiting a flight out of Afghanistan.

item.title: Liverpool man in Afghanistan rescue bid says no escape now
item.description: The Liverpool taxi driver travelled to Afghanistan 10 days ago to rescue his wife and children.

item.title: Covid: Devon and Cornwall offered extra support against rising cases
item.description: Extra resources will help with the vaccine roll-out and there will be greater capacity for testing.

item.title: Missing Lancaster girl, two, abducted and flown to Spain
item.description: Police believe two-year-old Gracie-May boarded a plane at Glasgow Airport with her parents.

item.title: Convicted gang member bragged about wealth in music videos
item.description: Akeem Chand, 27, rapped about the money he was making through illicit activities.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Man Utd 'reach agreement' to re-sign Juventus forward
item.description: Manchester United confirm they have reached an agreement to re-sign Cristiano Ronaldo from Juventus.

item.title: Teen jailed for life for murdering father-of-two in Stevenage
item.description: Christopher Hewett was stabbed to death after an exchange of words with a group of youths by a shop.

item.title: Benjamin Mendy: Manchester City footballer remanded in custody on rape charges
item.description: Defender Benjamin Mendy is charged with four counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.

item.title: Fulham solicitor accused of injecting blood into stores' food
item.description: The solicitor appeared in court accused of injecting blood into food at three west London stores.

item.title: Bury pub landlord catches Lee Rigby collection box thief
item.description: Stewart Spensley, who served with Lee Rigby, chased the thief when the box was taken from his bar.

item.title: Paul Taylor's rude name place tour suffers hitch after Twatt
item.description: Paul Taylor had ridden 1,200 miles before breaking down on a remote mountain pass in Aberdeenshire.

item.title: Drone footage reveals scale of Leamington Spa fire
item.description: Flame and thick, dark smoke fills the sky above Leamington Spa.

item.title: 'It's just nice to feel welcome somewhere'
item.description: Children with missing limbs meet up in South Yorkshire to speak to others like them.

item.title: Bournemouth park busker pinned to floor by police
item.description: Videos of the incident show the busker's face covered in blood after being forced to the floor.

item.title: 'Shocking' Hull A63 crossing attempt caught on CCTV
item.description: Footage shows the man squeezing through the central reservation as traffic passes just feet away.

item.title: Hundreds of fish die after huge Coventry warehouse fire
item.description: An investigation is probing whether water run-off from the warehouse blaze polluted a nearby lake.

item.title: Boy awaiting heart transplant lives in hospital
item.description: Eight-year-old Oscar is in a Leeds hospital waiting for an urgent heart transplant.

item.title: London Underground usage regularly reaches 50% of pre-Covid levels
item.description: Passenger numbers continue to rise on London's transport system following the Covid crisis.

item.title: Prince William praises 'moral courage' of arson-hit former marine
item.description: Sean Ivey's home was destroyed in a fire he believes was started after he called out local yobs.

item.title: Bloodstock festival: 500 people who went to event test positive
item.description: Organisers say they did "everything in their power" to lessen risks, going beyond official guidance.

item.title: Suffolk man who dined-and-dashed after lockdown jailed
item.description: A judge said: "While others were eating out to help out, you were eating out to help yourself."

item.title: England v India: Cheteshwar Pujara & Virat Kohli repel hosts at Headingley
item.description: England's push for victory in the third Test is met by stubborn resistance from India on day three at Headingley.

item.title: Europa League draw: Leicester, West Ham, Rangers & Celtic discover groups
item.description: Leicester, West Ham, Rangers and Celtic discover who they will face in the 2021-22 Europa League group stage, while Tottenham find out their Europa Conference League opponents

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Kadeena Cox sets new world record to win gold
item.description: British star Kadeena Cox sets a new world record to retain her C4-5 500m time trial title at the Tokyo Paralympics.
